entries.decision: Use deny > ask > allow precedence for permission safety
entries.rationale: Deny rules must have highest precedence to block dangerous commands even if they match ask/allow patterns

entries.decision: Put rm:* in ask list with specific dangerous patterns in deny
entries.rationale: This allows safe rm commands (like rm node_modules) with user confirmation, while blocking destructive patterns (rm -rf /) unconditionally
Team-shared settings ensure consistent safety across all users, while personal settings allow customization without affecting others

entries.decision: Create separate /do-tdd command instead of --tdd flag on /do
entries.rationale: User preferred explicit command over additional flag to reduce complexity. Separate command makes TDD workflow first-class and clear.

entries.decision: Enforce test existence gate - block implementation until tests exist
entries.rationale: True TDD requires tests to exist before implementation. Gate ensures workflow is followed, not just suggested.

entries.decision: Use RED-GREEN-REFACTOR phases with explicit phase tracking
entries.rationale: Classic TDD cycle provides clear structure. Phase tracking in loop state enables resume from any point.

entries.decision: Re-tag version after merge to include actual feature code
entries.rationale: v3.7.0 was originally tagged on pre-merge commit. After squash merge, tag needed to be moved to include the actual feature implementation.

entries.decision: Use squash merge for feature PRs
entries.rationale: Squash merge keeps main branch clean with one commit per feature. Preserves full history in PR for reference.

entries.decision: Use quoted heredoc for init.sh content in setup.sh
entries.rationale: Single quotes inside single-quoted string caused syntax error. Quoted heredoc (<<'EOF') preserves all special characters including single quotes

entries.decision: Make gitignore update MANDATORY in /setup command
entries.rationale: Previous soft instructions were not being followed. CRITICAL + DO NOT SKIP ensures ephemeral files are properly gitignored
